items.summary: Australians working in Japan's ski fields say while the sport has unpredictable risks, there are ways to be prepared.

items.title: CIA says it will cease publishing the World Factbook, a free online resource used by millions
items.summary: A statement on the CIA's website gives no reason for the decision, simply stating that the Factbook has been "sunset" while encouraging readers to "stay curious about the world and find ways to explore it".

items.title: Police executing drug raid find deadly snakes, crocodile in alleged makeshift zoo
items.summary: More than 50 reptiles, including a 1.3-metre crocodile, have been seized after police discovered an alleged makeshift zoo during a drug raid on the NSW Mid North Coast.

items.title: New resource connects people with organisations on front lines of bushfire relief effort
items.summary: A new online resource aims to make it easier for people to contribute to bushfire relief efforts across Victoria.

items.title: Worker's death at Tanami gold mine in Central Australia under investigation
items.summary: A 47-year-old worker has died following an incident at the Tanami gold mine in remote Central Australia, with police and NT WorkSafe investigating.

items.title: Sydney man, 19, charged over alleged threats to kill Israeli president
items.summary: Darcy Tinning was arrested by AFP officers on Wednesday and charged with making a threat to kill an "internationally protected person".

items.title: NRL rookie Sebastian Su'a poised for breakout year after injury-plagued 2025 season with Dolphins
items.summary: The work ethic of a former Test fast bowler and the mentoring of an elite prop are inspiring Dolphins rookie Sebastian Su'a's NRL quest.

items.title: Donald Trump, gold, interest rates and AI data centres to dominate company reporting season
items.summary: Australia's mining sector is expected to lead the earnings charge for this reporting season, boosted by signs of a stabilisation in the Chinese economy and a turbo-charged commodities market.

items.title: Homeless Whitsunday boaties begin long rebuild after Tropical Cyclone Koji carnage
items.summary: Around a dozen boats recovered by Marine Safety Queensland were part-time or permanent liveaboard boats, with boaties in the Whitsundays facing a long journey to find a new permanent home on or off the water.

items.title: Ukraine and Russia wrap 'productive' first day of US-backed peace talks in Abu Dhabi, as war rages on
items.summary: The two-day trilateral meeting began after Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Russia had exploited a US-backed energy truce last week to stockpile munitions before attacking Ukraine with a record number of ballistic missiles.

items.title: Central Queensland conservation group wants to see more transparency on coal mine water releases

items.title: What is the difference between a tropical low and cyclone in northern Australia?

items.title: Police launch investigation into sudden death in Toowoomba
items.summary: Police have closed part of Bell Street and the Toowoomba bus terminal car park on Chronicle Lane in Toowoomba's CBD as part of the investigation.

items.title: Silver plunges over 14 per cent as ACTU pushes above-inflation wages — as it happened
items.summary: Spot silver has hit a new low, crashing to $US75 an ounce, down over 14 per cent, while the ACTU is pushing for "above-inflation" wage increases in 2026.

items.title: Parramatta Eels veteran Josh Addo-Carr urges young teammates to step up after Zac Lomax depature

items.title: Fears SA's endangered glossy black-cockatoo eggs will 'cook' in nesting boxes during heatwave
items.summary: South Australia's population of a unique subspecies of glossy black-cockatoos is heavily dependent on artificial nesting boxes. That could pose a problem during extreme heat conditions.

items.title: Report calls for Australia to grow security, trade and diplomatic ties with Taiwan because of China's influence
items.summary: Experts say Australia needs to do more to grow its relationship with Taiwan as China works to diplomatically isolate Taipei in the region.

items.summary: Marius Borg Høiby is pleading not guilty to the most serious charges of rape and domestic violence but admits some lesser charges, including driving too fast.

items.title: Living costs rise for all but some hit harder, new ABS data finds

items.title: Doberman pinscher named Penny wins top prize at Westminster Dog Show

items.title: Olympic sports face 'difficult conversations' before Brisbane 2032 as IOC president confirms reforms
items.summary: Brisbane Olympic organisers say they do not know what events will be at the 2032 Games, as IOC president Kirsty Coventry says her reforms will result in "difficult conversations" with established sports.

items.summary: Thomas Fancutt has made his return to professional tennis after receiving a 10-month ban for a vitamin and magnesium infusion.

items.summary: Shadow Minister for Health Sarah Mitchell has successfully moved a motion in parliament for an inquiry at the Calvary Mater Hospital, after the discovery of mould and maggots.

items.title: Malaysian PM Anwar Ibrahim and India's Narendra Modi named in Epstein files
items.summary: The prime ministers of Malaysia and India deny having links with disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein after their names appeared in a tranche of files released by the US Department of Justice.

items.title: Desperate need for medical evacuations in Gaza as Rafah crossing reopens

items.summary: The $15 billion fund will be allowed to back riskier green projects under new rules announced today.

items.title: Diamonds eye timely glimpse of Jamaica in Test series ahead of Commonwealth Games
items.summary: Australia's netballers expect to gain precious intelligence ahead of a showpiece tournament when they host Jamaica in a three-Test series.

items.title: Ban on sand flathead fishing in south-eastern Tasmania amid severe decline in numbers

items.title: Art exhibitions to see this summer, from Ron Mueck to Hobart Current and Olafur Eliasson

items.summary: The SA government has stepped in with an "unprecedented" offer of direct low-interest loans to farmers hit hard by years of drought.

items.title: Four new rule changes announced for the 2026 NRL season, kick-off tweak to be trialled
items.summary: A proposed rule change to the rugby league kick-off will not be enforced at the start of the 2026 NRL season and will instead be trialled during matches later in the year.
